tit.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 紙切り（かみきり）とは、紙を鋏で切り、形を作る伝統芸能のひとつである。
sen.e: "Kamikiri" is one of the traditional Japanese performing arts, which shows the performance of cutting a piece of paper in some shape with a pair of scissors.
"Kamikiri" is one of the traditional Japanese performing arts, which shows the performance of cutting a piece of paper in some shape with a pair of scissors.
"Kamikiri" is one of the traditional Japanese performing arts, which shows the performance of cutting a piece of paper in some shape with a pair of scissors.

sen.j: 寄席では色物の一つとして紙切りの芸を披露するが、客からのリクエストに応える場合もある。
sen.e: At a vaudeville theater, the performance of kamikiri is shown as one of "iromono" (various entertainments other than storytelling), and sometimes it is shown in response to the requests of the audience.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: At a vaudeville theater, the performance of kamikiri is shown as one of "iromono" (various entertainments other than storytelling), and sometimes it is shown in response to the requests of the audience.

At a vaudeville theater, the performance of kamikiri is shown as one of "iromono" (various entertainments other than storytelling), and sometimes it is shown in response to the requests of the audience.

sen.j: 縁起物や芝居の一場面など古典的なものから、動物やアニメのキャラクターまで題材は多岐に渡る。
sen.e: Kamikiri covers various subjects from classical ones, such as a good luck charm & a scene of a play, to an animal & a cartoon character.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Kamikiri covers various subjects from classical ones, such as a good luck charms or scenes of a play, to animals or cartoon characters.
Kamikiri covers various subjects from classical ones, such as a good luck charms or scenes of a play, to animals or cartoon characters.

sen.j: 形で表現するのに難しいお題も、その場で頓知を利かせて具現化させたり、切っている最中も黙ったりせず、客を飽きさせないように喋り続けるなど、単に紙を切る技術だけでは成立しない芸である。
sen.e: Kamikiri is a performing art more than just paper cutting craft, because a performer gives shape to the subject - no matter how difficult it is - with his (or her) wit on the spot, and because he (or she) contiues talking something while cutting the paper not to make the audience get bored with the performance.

Kamikiri is a performing art more than just a paper cutting craft, because a performer gives shape to the subject - no matter how difficult it is - with his (or her) wit on the spot, and because he (or she) contiues talking while cutting the paper so the audience won't be bored with the performance.

Kamikiri is a performing art more than just a paper cutting craft, because a performer gives shape to the subject - no matter how difficult it is - with his (or her) wit on the spot, and because he (or she) contiues talking while cutting the paper so the audience won't be bored with the performance.

sen.j: 切りあがったものは、ほとんど客に供される。
sen.e: Most of the finished works are given to the audience.
Most of the finished works are given to the audience.
Most of the finished works are given to the audience.

sen.j: 江戸時代、宴席の余興に謡や音曲に合わせて、様々な形を切り抜く芸として始まったとされる。
sen.e: Kamikiri is said to have begun in the Edo period as an entertainment of a party, in which a performer cut a piece of paper in various shapes in accord with "utai" (the chanting of a Noh text) or with songs accompanied by "shamisen" (a three-stringed Japanese banjo).

Kamikiri is said to have begun during the Edo period as a form of entertainment for a party, in which a performer cut a piece of paper in various shapes according to "utai" (the chanting of a Noh text) or with songs accompanied by "shamisen" (a three-stringed Japanese banjo).

Kamikiri is said to have begun during the Edo period as a form of entertainment for a party, in which a performer cut a piece of paper in various shapes according to utai (the chanting of a Noh text) or with songs accompanied by shamisen (a three-stringed Japanese banjo).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 寄席の出し物としては1873年（明治6年）に幇間の喜楽亭おもちゃが高座で披露した。
sen.e: In 1873, "Omocha KIRAKUTEI," a buffoon, showed his performance of kamikiri on "koza" (the stage on which a comic storyteller sits) in a vaudeville theater.
In 1873, "Omocha KIRAKUTEI," a buffoon, showed his performance of kamikiri on "koza" (the stage on which a comic storyteller sits) in a vaudeville theater.

sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: しかし色物の中でも地味な芸であった為、以降も寄席では数人しか紙切り芸人はおらず、当時の作品は殆ど残っていない。
sen.e: Even after that, however, kamikiri was such an inconspicuous performance of all iromono that few performed kamikiri at a vaudeville theater, and today there remain few works of kamikiri made in those days.

Even after that, however, kamikiri was such an inconspicuous performance of all iromono that few performed kamikiri at a vaudeville theater, and today there remain only a few works of kamikiri made in those days.

sen.j: 戦後、テレビ放送が始まると、切り絵クイズ番組に出演した林家正楽が有名となった。
sen.e: When TV broadcast began after World War Ⅱ, "Shoraku HAYASHIYA" became famous, who appeared on a TV kamikiri quiz show.
sen.cmt: ※ここでは「切り絵」は「紙切り」と同義に扱われているので、「紙切り」と区別せずに訳しています（セル18、20も同様）。
sen.e: When TV broadcast began after World War Ⅱ, "Shoraku HAYASHIYA" became famous, with those who appeared on a TV kamikiri quiz show.
When TV broadcast began after World War Ⅱ, Shoraku HAYASHIYA became famous, with those who appeared on a TV kamikiri quiz show.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 当初テレビ局側は紙切り芸人の柳家一兆に依頼したが、「クイズに使う、訳のわからない切り絵は正楽に頼め」と断った為、初代正楽が紙切りでクイズを出題する事になった。
sen.e: At first, the TV station asked "Iccho YANAGIYA," a kamikiri performer, to appear on TV, but he refused, saying they should ask Shoraku to do so about a nonsense kamikiri performance in a quiz show, so they followed, and the first Shoraku got to give quizzes about kamikiri on TV.

At first, the TV station asked "Iccho YANAGIYA," a kamikiri performer, to appear on TV, but he refused, saying they should ask Shoraku to do it about a nonsense kamikiri performance in a quiz show, so they followed his advice, and the first Shoraku got to perform kamikiri on TV.

At first, the TV station asked Itcho YANAGIYA, a kamikiri performer, to appear on TV, but he refused, saying they should ask Shoraku to do it about a nonsense kamikiri performance in a quiz show, so they followed his advice, and the first Shoraku got to perform kamikiri on TV.
sen.cmt: Iccho→Itchoに修正、クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 柳家一兆（後の花房一兆、小倉一兆）の弟子には、「モダン紙切り」で人気を博した花房蝶二や、現在、鋏切絵作家としても活動している柳家松太郎がいる。
sen.e: Iccho YANAGIYA, who changed his name into "Iccho HANABUSA," and then into "Iccho OGURA," had pupils, such as "Choji HANABUSA," who became popular for "modern kamikiri," and "Shotaro YANAGIYA," who makes activities today not only as a comic storyteller but also as a kamikiri performer.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Iccho YANAGIYA, who changed his name to "Iccho HANABUSA," and then into "Iccho OGURA," had pupils, such as "Choji HANABUSA," who became popular for "modern kamikiri," and "Shotaro YANAGIYA," who performs not only as a comic storyteller, but also as a kamikiri performer.

Itcho YANAGIYA, who changed his name to Itcho HANABUSA, and then into Itcho OGURA, had pupils, such as Choji HANABUSA, who became popular for 'modern kamikiri,' and Shotaro YANAGIYA, who performs not only as a comic storyteller, but also as a kamikiri performer.

sen.j: また、初代正楽の弟子には2代目正楽、林家今丸がいた。
sen.e: And the first Shoraku had a pupil "Imamaru HAYASHIYA" (the second Shoraku).

sen.j: 2代目正楽は当初、落語家として林家彦六に入門したが、言葉の訛りが抜けず落語家を断念、紙切りとして初代正楽に弟子入りした。
sen.e: At first, the second Shoraku became a pupil of "Hikoroku HAYASHIYA" to be a comic storyteller, but he had to give up this path because of his accent, so instead, he became a pupil of the first Shoraku to be a kamikiri performer.

sen.j: その2代目正楽の弟子には、3代目正楽と林家二楽がいるが、二楽は2代目正楽の次男である（長男は落語家の桂小南治）。
sen.e: The second Shoraku has two pupils, the third Shoraku & "Niraku HAYASHIYA" (his second son); his first son is a comic storyteller "Konanji KATSURA."

sen.e: In foreign countries, kamikiri is regarded as an unique performance, so it is also called "paper cutting craft."

sen.j: 現在は静岡市在住で、鋏切絵作家としての活動の他、切り絵教室の講師も務める。

sen.j: 幼少の頃より紙切りに興味を持ち、以来、独学で紙切りの芸を磨く。
sen.e: He became interested in kamikiri in his childhood, and thereafter he polished up his skill of kamikiri by himself.

sen.j: 趣味の一環としていたが、周囲に勧められて1981年にプロとしてデビュー。
sen.e: He did it just as one of his hobbies, but in 1981, encouraged by other people, he made his debut as a professional kamikiri performer.

sen.j: 独自に編み出した手法をもって、単に紙切りではなく「江戸紙切り」と称する。
sen.e: Having an unique skill, he calls his performance "Edo kamikiri" to distinguish it from other kamikiri.

sen.e: On October 4, 1976, a girl who later became "Chiaki KIRIGAMIST" was born in Tokoro-cho, Kitami City, Hokkaido Prefecture, and she was raised in the nearby Abashiri City.

sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 幼少の頃に見た2代目林家正楽の紙切り芸に魅せられて以来、切り絵は大好きな遊びの一つとなる。
sen.e: She was fascinated by the kamikiri performance of the second Shoraku HAYASHIYA in her childhood, and after that, kamikiri became one of her favorite amusements.
She was fascinated by the kamikiri performance of the second Shoraku HAYASHIYA in her childhood, and after that, kamikiri became one of her favorite amusements.
She was fascinated by the kamikiri performance of the second Shoraku HAYASHIYA in her childhood, and after that, kamikiri became one of her favorite amusements.

sen.j: 1997年に札幌市の大道芸イベントで路上パフォーマーとしてデビュー。
sen.e: In 1997, she made her debut as a street performer in the street performance event in Sapporo City.
In 1997, she made her debut as a street performer in the street performance event in Sapporo City.
In 1997, she made her debut as a street performer in the street performance event in Sapporo City.

sen.j: 2002年に札幌在住の上方落語家、桂枝光に弟子入り、「花りん（かりん）」の芸名でよしもとクリエイティブ・エージェンシー札幌事務所に所属した。
sen.e: In 2002, she became a pupil of "Shiko KATSURA" (a Sapporo resident & a comic storyteller of "Kamigata" [Kyoto and Osaka area]), and she belonged to Yoshimoto Creative Agency Sapporo Office by the stage name of "Karin."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In 2002, she became a pupil of "Shiko KATSURA" (a Sapporo resident and a comic storyteller of "Kamigata" [Kyoto and Osaka area]), and she belonged to Yoshimoto Creative Agency Sapporo Office with the stage name of "Karin."

In 2002, she became a pupil of Shiko KATSURA (a Sapporo resident and a comic storyteller of "Kamigata," or Kyoto and Osaka area), and she belonged to Yoshimoto Creative Agency Sapporo Office with the stage name of 'Karin.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーション修正・削除、カッコ内を一部修正

sen.j: しかし、後に桂枝光門下を破門になり、千陽に改名した。
sen.e: But later, she was excommunicated by the members of the school of Shiko KATSURA, and she changed her stage name to "Chiaki" (in Chinese characters, written as "千陽").
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。※セル86では同じ読みながら違う漢字を用いているため敢えて「千陽」の漢字表記も残しました。
sen.e: But later, she was excommunicated by the members of the school of Shiko KATSURA, and she changed her stage name to "Chiaki" (in Chinese characters, written as "千陽").
But later, she was excommunicated by the members of the school of Shiko KATSURA, and she changed her stage name to Chiaki (in Chinese characters, written as "千陽").
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 現在はKIRIGAMIST千陽（きりがみすとちあき）として、主に北海道内で活動している。
sen.e: At present, she performs kamikiri with the stage name of "Chiaki KIRIGAMIST" mainly in Hokkaido Prefecture.
At present, she performs kamikiri under the stage name of "Chiaki KIRIGAMIST" mainly in Hokkaido Prefecture.

sen.j: 2007年8月には千亜紀名義で切り絵個展「刀雅」を開催。
sen.e: In August 2007, she held an one-person kamikiri exhibition titled "Toga" (Cutting Works' Elegance) by the name of "Chiaki" (in Chinese characters, written as "千亜紀").
sen.cmt: ※「刀雅」の括弧書きは、定訳が見つかりませんでしたので訳者の手になる拙訳です。

sen.j: アーティストとしても卓抜な才能を持つ事を証明する。
sen.e: This exhibition proved she has an outstanding talent for kamikiri art besides storytelling.

sen.j: 前座修行を終え、2008年9月より寄席に出演。

sen.j: 上方噺家で後ろ紙切りを得意とする。
sen.e: "Emimaru HAYASHIYA" is a comic storyteller of Kamigata, and he is good at performing kamikiri with his hands behind his back.

tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: アンリ・マティスなどにより、切り紙絵による作品制作もなされている。
sen.e: Some artists, including Henri Matisse, left some works of "kirigamie" (or "kirie") - the art in which an artist cut a piece of paper in some shape, paste it onto a different-colored mount, thereby setting off the color.
sen.cmt: ※ここでの「切り紙絵」は「紙切り」とは少し異なり、「一定の形に切り取った紙を異なるカラーの台紙に張り、その色のコントラストで見た目を引き立たせる芸術」（「切り絵」ともいう）のことです（それをダッシュの後で説明しています。）
sen.e: Some artists, including Henri Matisse, left some works of "kirigamie" (or "kirie") - the art in which an artist cuts a piece of paper in some shape, pastes it onto a different-colored mount, thereby setting off the color.

Some artists, including Henri MATISSE, left some works of "kirigamie" (or "kirie") - the art in which an artist cuts a piece of paper in some shape, pastes it onto a different-colored mount, thereby setting off the color.
